title: Is something ever going to be done about Relic and Allies?
body:
Maybe I've just been unlucky but it seems that the moment I show up to a lane with full stacks allies just go full monkey and kill everything in sight.

I don't care if you keep the mechanic for laning phase, but once that's done, something needs to be made so that the support player is not at the absolute mercy of whether the rest of their team has a brain or not.

Like, I don't know, maybe add an effect to the fully upgraded item where a minion only has to die in close proximity (150-300 range?) of the support to proc the effect. Makes it so supports still have to sit in the minion wave to get stuff without necessarily turning it into Coin 2.0

replies.body: I agree the mechanic only means something more to worry about - can you get last hits before Yasuo and Sivir delete the lane. Honestly there has been a massive number of occasions when I don't get a single last hit with it time and time again.

I'm at the point that I wish they would just buff coin so I don't have to use relic anymore. Late game relic shield is an absolute pain. 

But Meddler said that they are going to go through a period of relative calm and balance until the preseason, so I'm hoping these sorts of changes are what the team has in mind.
Let's be fair here. {{item:3401}} has way better stats for a support than {{item:3069}} . As you transition into late game, stats start to matter more than gold, particularly for melee champions.

You aren't wrong, but it's also missing my point. 

I don't think {{item:3401}} is weak, it's just a pain to use. You have to spend too much mental energy on an un-fun minigame when you have this item.

> You have to spend too much mental energy on an un-fun minigame when you have this item.

No you don't. You don't HAVE to use the item after 20 minutes. As a melee support (Blitz, Pyke, Leona, Braum, Alistar) you should be much more focused on getting picks and getting your team ahead that way. When you're worried about positioning, vision, and potentially setting up a surprise flank, why would you want to show your position to the enemy team inside a lane for a few hundred gold?

When there's a mechanic on the other gold items that doesn't have to be ignored, that's when it's clear to me that the item isn't well designed. It's the only gold item with this problem. That's why I don't think it has a place anymore.

Again, you're right, but I feel you're kind of missing the point. The gold item for tank supports *shouldn't* be useless after 20 minutes. That's lame design.

The gold item for tank supports ISN'T useless after 20 minutes. It gives tanks a good chunk of health and health regen for super cheap, in a world where tank items are expensive and give less health than they used to. 

The gold is not the only important aspect of the item. The other items have terrible stats, so they give more gold.

... I understand that it's balanced. My complaint has nothing to do with that. At all.

The gold quest is not fun. Balance has nothing to do with it.

i started taking coin and edge because let's face it... it's not worth sacrificing wards until 20 minutes in when you can literally afk in lane and get wards at 8 minutes using coin. even on pyke i only take coin now.
It would be nice to see the charges convert to the old shield battery mechanic relic used to have.  It would need a bit of twerking but would feel better than the minion execute later in the game.
How would the passive that gives shield help with killing minions faster than your allies can?

I mean for lane phase the relic execute is fine, but when the quest/lane phase is over having the proc change into a shield instead would feel better.

After giving it a bit of thought it might be interesting to see the execute damage scale with total HP too.

It is somewhat stressful, really.

There's something really unnerving about having to rush ahead of allies just so that I put the wave low enough that I can quickly execute a number of them once my ally gets there. Or if my ally is already there, it's always a massive gamble whether or not it's worth my time to come and get a few stacks when I'm not even sure I'll get to proc any.

I agree with this. I think there are three major problems with the Relic Shield line at this point: number one, it's the only support income item that specifically relies on allies playing well in order to work, and it does so by having allies do something they normally wouldn't do, i.e. hold off on CS. This leads to the support getting screwed over when allies farm absent-mindedly, which is especially common in uncoordinated games. Number two, it's an item line whose passive only really makes sense in lane, because after the laning phase the support is usually expected to go out and ward, not join their allies to farm (and if they try that, the waves are usually cleared before they get there). Number three, because the item line's balanced heavily around team coordination, it's affected it to such a degree that it generally feels awkward to use in pubs, while being so good in pro play that even the marksman will sometimes take a Relic Shield as well at the start.

Because of this, I think it might be better to give the item a buddy mechanic as with Taric's W or Knight's Vow, so that both players get to share gold from their minion kills, to at least some extent. It might even be worth sacrificing some of the item's other bonuses, such as its heal or passive Gp10, and adding conditionals to prevent overlap with Ancient Coin, such as a short leash range that increases with game time, but otherwise it could help smooth over the item's problems, while still encouraging teammates to coordinate.

Most support item passives don't transition so well in the late-game. Coin users tend to not be that mana hungry, Spellthief's damage isn't that impressive and assuming minions are nearby, Relic heals as much per stack as a fully stacked Remnant of the Watchers. So I don't really care how useful the heal is, but hey, if they want to make all of them relevant, all the power to them.

It's really more about not being at your team's mercy. Coin users can see a wave coming and simply stop by as an ally clears them to get their spoils. The better Spellthief users typically have ways to easily hit an enemy or two to get money and are the only ones to get money for fights, kills/assists be damned. 

Relic users just ... hope their team lets them to their thing. And it's not even a good thing. There's certainly a part of me that feels bad when an ally is letting me get my stacks but I can't clear on my own so they have to come help me and then stay in range as they recall or I can't proc stuff and give them money. It's a very awkward process that no one really likes.

It really only works in lane, and even then, cannon minions have gotten so important that the enemy can easily make it a death sentence for tanks to go and get it. I feel like normalizing the gold gains from Relic procs would have been a much easier way to balance it out for them, and instead making the healing scale off of the minions. That way the player can focus on how risky he's willing to be to get more healing and not have to constantly think about his bank account.

Why not just make your autos "mark" a minion after you've completed the quest, like Quinn's passive or something? You can only mark one minion at a time, and if an ally champion last hits before you, you get the gold and heal like if you executed it?

It won't get you the whole wave, but it might help out.

It's funny when they deny you like 100g per wave, then you have no gold to buy items to keep them alive and they die.
"noob support"

It's not inherently an LCS problem.

The main issue is that it's the only support item that does NOT punish you for killing minions. So the ADCs were building it for the sustain and mild gold advantage.
And when the carry picks a support item over the intended items, there's a problem.

I really hope next year they redo support items entirely so these kinds of problems don't occur, I also want it so supports actually build them (this happens a lot in lower elos...).

I think making their base forms maybe do nothing aside give stats, then giving their upgrades GP/5 might be a way to tackle the problem.
And get rid of the gimmicks and quests. Make them transform into good items instead.

Make it so if an ally kills a cannon and you have a proc, it uses your proc. Not every minion, just the cannon. Relic was nerfed so heavily because of cannon buffs that missing a cannon completely cripples relic users.

Theyre probably concerned about using it to hardpush but really, in what world is that going to matter outside of laning? Even for clearing supers its nothing special.

I disagree with the proximity procs, unless there’s an exception. It should not proc by proximity when the enemy has baron or banner on a minion. That is, there shouldn’t be an execute by proximity.

It is a frustrating mechanic, for sure. But I do get that sometimes clearing the wave quickly takes priority over getting all of your procs.

Oh it's definitely just a throwaway idea. Thing is, if no one on the balance team can come up with an idea that's beneficial to the support players without breaking anything, then I would have to seriously doubt their competence.

Though I also didn't explain the idea properly. I was thinking along the lines of "if a minion dies while near you" kinda deal and not necessarily automatically executing any minion in range.
What if they gave it something similar to guardian but with a larger range, u stand in the circle around the support and it does the proc the heal then prioritizing who's ever in the circle

It does suck to be limited purely to your GP/10 on the item... which is nerfed to 1g per 10 recently.   It's basically the income one most reliant on other people letting you have gold.  Frostfang, you control it by poking and are rewarded.  Coin, just be near the wave as it dies and they are there.  Even the other two income items have more gp / 10 than you so they just outpace you.  Though theory max, relic shield should have the highest income.

It's frustrating though to rely on your allies essentially being nice to you to let you aa one thing.  Then if they do let you, you have to AA a minion at just the right health.  you should be targeting cannons but late game they have so much HP that it's basically a waste of time lol

They could give the completed Relic item a small aura that procs charges when minions in the AoE die.  It wouldn't need a radius any larger than a melee autoattack.  That would still give the support some control over which minions it gets used on.

Or, when a charge is available, make your AA mark a minion for X seconds like said above.
Totally agree with the proximity procs.  Especially when I'm playing Nasus and a support comes by I'm torn between sharing the gold or getting those sweet, sweet stax.

Make it so when you ping the item after sightstone quest it shows remaining charges not remaining wards.
Previously my strategy was to dump every ping I was allowed onto my relic/targon repeatedly until I got the stacks, people usually figured it out after 4 screens full of "Face of the mountain: 4 charges remaining"

Prepare for people coming in saying "Hey when I need to shove the wave so we can't start sieging don't complain about me doing my job!"

Of course that's your job! But it's not your job to blast a wave when you're just clearing it while waiting for people to group. Us supports are not talking about when you're pushing, we aren't stupid, it's that all of you guys do this even when it costs NOTHING to you or the game to just let the support execute some minions.

Or at a reduced threshold

Tbh spellthiefs need more help, i can be poking constantly in lane lvls 1-5 back for t2 and only be 70-120 gold ahead of the enemy support with coin. spellthiefs tho actually requires you to interact w/ the enemy and you can't gain gold from it passively while your team clears waves unlike coin and relic and it feels like u risk alot less going coin than you stand to gain from spellthiefs. Especially considering usually the enemy is semi-competent enough to zone you back or fight back so unless your absolutely stomping theres a good chance the coin user is gaining more.

I really have to wonder what they gained by making it so Spellthief can only proc once per spell. I always felt it did more bad than good. All it really did was make Brand and Morgana unable to get all stacks done with one attack. Meanwhile, every other support got shafted because for a lot of them, hitting multiple enemies with one skill was the only way they could get some leeway between spell casts and not going oom instantly.

It made the item alot less competitive as a whole. It was always a risk / reward item, the only really motive to keep it now is A) it gives AP unlike coin even if its a marginal amount, and B it gives mana regen which is probably less sustain than coin considering your forced to constantly be using spells but stacks with athenes late to allow you to scale better. 
Athenes stacking / slightly better stats for High risk gold gen and no way to gain gold reliably w/ out enemies around, its hardly a fair trade in its current state.

Back before riot killed sight stone, relic procs had increased attack speed to help you get em faster.

Like most things that happened in that update, no clue ehy they removed it.

Didn't even notice they removed it. Even if they did though, I always found that mechanic to be hilariously bad. Like "Oh hey we're gonna help you get your sweet stacks but you'll still have to fight your own team to get it lolz".

This ain't a Super Mario game, I shouldn't be rushing and kicking allies away to get gold.
